meanings.definition: A violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow.
meanings.sent1: The storm outside made the trees sway wildly.
meanings.sent2: We had to cancel our picnic due to the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The storm seemed to be in a bad mood today, shaking everything in its path.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a storm, fierce and unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The storm roared through the night, leaving chaos in its wake.

meanings.definition: A tumultuous reaction; an uproar or controversy.
meanings.sent1: The announcement caused a storm of excitement among the students.
meanings.sent2: The political scandal created a media storm.
meanings.sent3: The storm of laughter that followed his joke was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her words sparked a storm of emotions within him.
meanings.sent5: The storm of applause filled the auditorium after the performance.

meanings.definition: To move angrily or forcefully in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: She stormed out of the room after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The protesters stormed the gates of the government building.
meanings.sent3: The toddler stormed around the house, upset about his lost toy.
meanings.sent4: He stormed into the meeting, demanding to be heard.
meanings.sent5: The team stormed to victory in the final minutes of the game.
